RECREATIONAL.summary: It is legal for adults 21 and older to possess cannabis in Illinois. The Cannabis Regulation and Tax Act, effective January 1, 2020, allows Illinois residents to possess up to 30 grams of cannabis flower, 5 grams of cannabis concentrate, and 500 milligrams of THC in cannabis-infused products.
RECREATIONAL.gov_quote: For a person who is 21 years of age or older and a resident of this State, the possession limit is as follows: (1) 30 grams of cannabis flower; (2) no more than 500 milligrams of THC contained in cannabis-infused product; (3) 5 grams of cannabis concentrate.

RECREATIONAL.question: Is it legal for adults to possess cannabis in the state of Illinois?

The Cannabis Regulation and Tax Act, effective January 1, 2020, allows adults to purchase cannabis from licensed dispensaries, provided they present valid government-issued identification and comply with purchase limits.

RECREATIONAL_PUBLIC.summary: It is not legal to consume cannabis at a public business in Illinois. State law prohibits cannabis use in any public place, which includes businesses open to the public such as restaurants, bars, and retail stores, unless a local government has specifically authorized an on-site consumption lounge at a licensed dispensary or tobacco store.
RECREATIONAL_PUBLIC.gov_quote: "This Act does not permit any person to engage in, and does not prevent the imposition of any civil, criminal, or other penalties for engaging in, any of the following conduct: ... (F) using cannabis in any public place; ... As used in this Section, 'public place' means any place where a person could reasonably be expected to be observed by others. ... 'Public place' does not include a private residence unless the private residence is used to provide licensed child care, foster care, or other similar social service care on the premises."

MEDICAL_STORE.gov_quote: "Registered qualifying patients and designated caregivers may purchase medical cannabis from a licensed medical cannabis dispensary in Illinois. Cultivation is not allowed in federally subsidized housing, and landlords may prohibit it in rental properties. Distribution or gifting of homegrown cannabis is prohibited.
